para: AMIDE saves studies in an extensible XML based directory format called XIF (Xml Image Format). These data directories characteristically end with ".xif", and appear as files within AMIDE.

sect1.title: Format of Saved Studies
sect1.para: Although admittedly annoying from a data transfer standpoint, using a directory structure for saving study information has the decisive advantage of making the saved information easily accessible using standard command-line utilities and text-based tools.

Each XIF directory contains a file called "Study.xml" which contains the basic study parameters. Additional files can also be found in the XIF directory, such as ROI_*.xml files which contain ROI's, and Volume_*.xml files and their corresponding Volume_*.dat files, which contain the image data set parameters and the raw data respectively. The raw data file format is arbitrary, and is little endian 32-bit float by default.

sect1.title: Opening Studies
sect1.para: From the main window, select "File->Open", and a file selection widget will open up. Select an XIF filename in the right column, and then hit the "OK" button (or double click on the filename).

sect1.title: Saving Studies
sect1.para: To save a study, from the study window select "File->Save As" and a file selection dialog will appear. Look at the "selection:" line near the bottom of the window, if this is the desired XIF filename, hit "OK" and the file will be saved. If this is not the desired XIF filename, select or enter in the correct XIF study, and hit the "OK" button.

sect1.title: Exporting a View
sect1.para: To export one of the views (transverse/coronal/sagittal) to an external image file, select "File->Export View->[view]" from the menu. The saved data format is jpeg.
